Articles.Content: I built a probe, using a okto, 2 3x2 solar panels, 2 battery packs, a relay antenna, an Oscar-B, and a 48-7s (think that's the name of it). I launched it, accidentally took my gravity turn too hard, starting to flip. Esc>Revert Flight. I put fins on the rocket this time and it flew fine, I flew it into a 300 km orbit, using a Hohmann transfer to get up to geostationary. Anyway, I got 2889 km apoapsis, 2882 km periapsis, and 0.3 degrees inclination. Also, this happened:

Well, no offense but most people don't want to hear about these things. Everybody here can do what you did. Post about things that others CAN'T do, then you will get some rep. I'll give you some rep for trying to make you name here, just stun me with how awesome your accomplishment is later.

Edited May 27, 2017 by Alpha 360
"Kouston, we have several problems, but that doesn't matter so we want to continue on with the mission."
